meanings.definition: To divide or separate incorrectly or improperly.
meanings.sent1: I always mispart my hair when I try to make a ponytail.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to mispart the cake batter into unequal portions.
meanings.sent3: The magician's misparting of the cards made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to mispart tasks among her team members led to chaos in the project.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanation on how to mispart the fractions made it easy to understand.

meanings.definition: A mistake or error in dividing or separating something.
meanings.sent1: The mispart in the recipe caused the cake to turn out too salty.
meanings.sent2: She realized the mispart in the puzzle pieces only after completing half of it.
meanings.sent3: The mispart in the road signs confused the drivers and caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent4: His mispart in the calculations resulted in the wrong answer to the math problem.
meanings.sent5: The mispart in the assembly of the furniture made it wobbly and unstable.
